destinations.name: Tirupati
destinations.overview: A sacred pilgrimage city famous for the Sri Venkateswara Temple, blending spirituality and history.

hotels.name: Taj Tirupati
hotels.description: Modern luxury near the temple hills.

must_visit_spots.name: Sri Venkateswara Temple
must_visit_spots.description: One of the busiest temples globally.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: 550 km, 9-10 hr drive via NH44 or train (Renigunta Jn, 10 km from Tirupati). Flights available to Tirupati Airport (15 km).

destinations.name: Araku Valley
destinations.overview: A serene hill station known as Andhra’s Ooty, surrounded by lush greenery and tribal culture.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: 700 km, 14 hr drive via NH65 or train to Vishakhapatnam (120 km away) then cab.
travel_details.tips: Book train to Araku for scenic ride, pack warm clothes.

destinations.name: Vishakhapatnam
destinations.overview: A coastal gem with beaches, hills, and a vibrant port city vibe.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: 620 km, 11 hr drive via NH65 or direct flights (50 min) to Visakhapatnam Airport.
travel_details.tips: Explore beaches early, avoid peak summer.

destinations.name: Gandikota
destinations.overview: Known as India’s Hidden Grand Canyon, a historic village with a dramatic gorge.

must_visit_spots.name: Gandikota Fort
must_visit_spots.description: Ancient fort by the Pennar River.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: 380 km, 6-7 hr drive via NH44, or train to Kadapa (80 km away) then cab.

destinations.name: Lepakshi
destinations.overview: A quaint village with ancient temples and intricate architecture.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: 480 km, 8 hr drive via NH44, or train to Hindupur (15 km away) then cab.
travel_details.tips: Day trip feasible, limited dining options.

destinations.name: Tawang
destinations.overview: A Himalayan town with the famous Tawang Monastery and stunning mountain views.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 500 km, 18-20 hr drive via Tezpur.
travel_details.best_time: March to June, September to October
travel_details.tips: Inner Line Permit required, pack warm gear.

destinations.name: Ziro Valley
destinations.overview: A UNESCO site known for its tribal culture and scenic paddy fields.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 450 km, 15-16 hr drive via NH13.
travel_details.tips: Permit needed, attend Ziro Music Festival if possible.

destinations.name: Bomdila
destinations.overview: A peaceful hill town with monasteries and apple orchards.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 340 km, 12-14 hr drive via Tezpur.
travel_details.tips: Permit required, roads can be rough.

destinations.name: Itanagar
destinations.overview: The state capital with a mix of tribal heritage and natural beauty.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 400 km, 12-13 hr drive via NH15.
travel_details.tips: Permit needed, visit museums for history.

destinations.name: Sela Pass
destinations.overview: A high-altitude pass with snow-covered vistas and a sacred lake.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 430 km, 15-16 hr drive via Tawang Rd.
travel_details.best_time: April to June, September to October

destinations.name: Kaziranga National Park
destinations.overview: A UNESCO site famous for one-horned rhinos and rich biodiversity.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 220 km, 5-6 hr drive via NH27.

destinations.name: Majuli Island
destinations.overview: The world’s largest river island, rich in culture and natural beauty.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Jorhat (2.5 hr via Guwahati), then ferry (20 km).

destinations.name: Kamakhya Temple
destinations.overview: A major Shakti temple in Guwahati, steeped in spirituality.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), temple 10 km from airport.

destinations.name: Manas National Park
destinations.overview: A UNESCO site with diverse wildlife and scenic landscapes.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Guwahati (2.5 hr), then 180 km, 4-5 hr drive via NH27.
travel_details.tips: Closed in monsoon, carry rain gear.

destinations.name: Haflong
destinations.overview: Assam’s only hill station with serene lakes and rolling hills.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Silchar (2.5 hr via Guwahati), then 105 km, 3-4 hr drive.

destinations.name: Bodh Gaya
destinations.overview: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Bodh Gaya is where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi Tree.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Gaya Airport (12 km), Hyderabad to Gaya flight (approx. 2.5 hrs, 1,400 km), Gaya Junction (15 km).

destinations.name: Nalanda
destinations.overview: An ancient center of learning with ruins of the world’s oldest university.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Patna Airport (90 km), Hyderabad to Patna flight (approx. 2 hrs, 1,300 km), Rajgir Railway Station (12 km).

destinations.name: Rajgir
destinations.overview: A historical town with hot springs, ancient ruins, and Buddhist significance.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Patna Airport (100 km), Hyderabad to Patna flight (approx. 2 hrs, 1,300 km), Rajgir Railway Station (2 km).

destinations.name: Vaishali
destinations.overview: An ancient city linked to Lord Buddha and Jainism, known for its Ashokan Pillar.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Patna Airport (55 km), Hyderabad to Patna flight (approx. 2 hrs, 1,300 km), Hajipur Railway Station (35 km).

destinations.name: Vikramshila
destinations.overview: Ruins of an ancient Buddhist university near the Ganges.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Bhagalpur Airport (60 km), Hyderabad to Bhagalpur flight (via Delhi, approx. 4 hrs, 1,500 km), Bhagalpur Railway Station (50 km).

destinations.name: Chitrakote Waterfalls
destinations.overview: Known as the 'Niagara of India,' a majestic waterfall on the Indravati River.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Jagdalpur Airport (40 km), Hyderabad to Jagdalpur flight (approx. 1.5 hrs, 400 km), Jagdalpur Railway Station (38 km).

destinations.name: Bastar
destinations.overview: A tribal region famous for its culture, handicrafts, and natural beauty.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Jagdalpur Airport (5 km), Hyderabad to Jagdalpur flight (approx. 1.5 hrs, 400 km), Jagdalpur Railway Station (3 km).

destinations.name: Mainpat
destinations.overview: A serene hill station known as the 'Shimla of Chhattisgarh.'

travel_details.how_to_reach: Raipur Airport (250 km), Hyderabad to Raipur flight (approx. 1 hr, 650 km), Ambikapur (50 km).

destinations.name: Kanger Valley National Park
destinations.overview: A biodiversity-rich park with caves, waterfalls, and wildlife.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Jagdalpur Airport (30 km), Hyderabad to Jagdalpur flight (approx. 1.5 hrs, 400 km), Jagdalpur Railway Station (25 km).

destinations.name: Bhoramdeo Temple
destinations.overview: An 11th-century temple complex, often called the 'Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh.'

travel_details.how_to_reach: Raipur Airport (130 km), Hyderabad to Raipur flight (approx. 1 hr, 650 km), Kawardha (20 km).

destinations.name: Baga Beach
destinations.overview: A lively beach known for water sports, nightlife, and vibrant shacks.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Dabolim Airport (40 km), Hyderabad to Goa flight (approx. 1 hr, 600 km), Madgaon Railway Station (50 km).

destinations.name: Calangute Beach
destinations.overview: Goa’s busiest beach, famous for its long shoreline and tourist buzz.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Dabolim Airport (40 km), Hyderabad to Goa flight (approx. 1 hr, 600 km), Thivim Railway Station (20 km).

destinations.name: Dudhsagar Waterfalls
destinations.overview: A stunning four-tiered waterfall on the Mandovi River, surrounded by lush forest.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Dabolim Airport (60 km), Hyderabad to Goa flight (approx. 1 hr, 600 km), Kulem Railway Station (10 km).

destinations.name: Fort Aguada
destinations.overview: A 17th-century Portuguese fort offering panoramic sea views.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Dabolim Airport (40 km), Hyderabad to Goa flight (approx. 1 hr, 600 km), Panjim (15 km).

destinations.name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
destinations.overview: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, home to the remains of St. Francis Xavier.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Dabolim Airport (25 km), Hyderabad to Goa flight (approx. 1 hr, 600 km), Panjim (10 km).

destinations.name: Gir National Park
destinations.overview: The last refuge of the Asiatic lion, Gir is a biodiversity hotspot offering thrilling safaris.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Rajkot (750 km, 1.5 hr flight) then 160 km drive; or train to Junagadh (850 km, 18-20 hrs) then 55 km.
travel_details.tips: Park closed June-Oct due to monsoon.

destinations.name: Rann of Kutch
destinations.overview: A vast salt desert, famous for the Rann Utsav and surreal landscapes.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Bhuj (950 km, 2 hr flight) then 80 km drive; or train to Bhuj (1000 km, 22-24 hrs).

destinations.name: Somnath Temple
destinations.overview: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, a sacred coastal temple with historical significance.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Diu (800 km, 1.5 hr flight) then 85 km drive; or train to Veraval (900 km, 20-22 hrs).

destinations.name: Dwarka
destinations.overview: An ancient city tied to Lord Krishna, known for the Dwarkadhish Temple.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Jamnagar (950 km, 2 hr flight) then 130 km drive; or train to Dwarka (1050 km, 22-24 hrs).

destinations.name: Sabarmati Ashram
destinations.overview: Mahatma Gandhi’s historic ashram in Ahmedabad, a symbol of India’s freedom struggle.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Ahmedabad (870 km, 1.5 hr flight); or train (1200 km, 22-24 hrs).

destinations.name: Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary
destinations.overview: A haven for migratory birds near Gurugram, ideal for nature lovers.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Delhi (1250 km, 2 hr flight) then 50 km drive; or train to Gurugram (1500 km, 24-26 hrs).

destinations.name: Kurukshetra
destinations.overview: A historic city tied to the Mahabharata, rich in spiritual and cultural significance.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Chandigarh (1400 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 90 km drive; or train to Kurukshetra (1600 km, 26-28 hrs).

destinations.name: Pinjore Gardens
destinations.overview: Mughal-style gardens in Pinjore, a serene retreat near Chandigarh.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Chandigarh (1400 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 20 km drive; or train to Kalka (1500 km, 26-28 hrs).

destinations.name: Morni Hills
destinations.overview: Haryana’s only hill station, offering scenic views and tranquility.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Chandigarh (1400 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 45 km drive; or train to Chandigarh (1500 km, 26-28 hrs).

destinations.name: Damdama Lake
destinations.overview: A popular weekend getaway near Gurugram with boating and nature.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Delhi (1250 km, 2 hr flight) then 60 km drive; or train to Gurugram (1500 km, 24-26 hrs).

destinations.name: Manali
destinations.overview: A Himalayan paradise known for adventure, snow, and scenic beauty.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kullu (1500 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 40 km drive; or train to Chandigarh (1400 km, 26-28 hrs) then 310 km bus.
travel_details.best_time: March to June, October to February

destinations.name: Shimla
destinations.overview: The queen of hills, a colonial-era retreat with panoramic views.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Chandigarh (1400 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 115 km drive; or train to Kalka (1500 km, 26-28 hrs) then toy train.
travel_details.best_time: March to June, December to February

destinations.name: Dharamshala
destinations.overview: Home to the Dalai Lama, blending Tibetan culture with Himalayan charm.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kangra (1550 km, 3 hr flight) then 15 km drive; or train to Pathankot (1600 km, 28-30 hrs) then 90 km.
travel_details.best_time: March to June, September to November

destinations.name: Spiti Valley
destinations.overview: A cold desert valley with rugged landscapes and ancient monasteries.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kullu (1500 km, 2.5 hr flight) then 200 km drive; or train to Chandigarh then 450 km.
travel_details.tips: Inner Line Permit for some areas.

destinations.name: Kullu
destinations.overview: A valley town famous for its temples, rivers, and Dussehra festival.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kullu (1500 km, 2.5 hr flight); or train to Chandigarh (1400 km, 26-28 hrs) then 270 km bus.
travel_details.best_time: March to June, September to November

destinations.name: Betla National Park
destinations.overview: A biodiversity-rich park known for tigers, elephants, and scenic forests.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Ranchi (400 km) then drive 140 km; or train to Daltonganj (25 km).

destinations.name: Deoghar
destinations.overview: A pilgrimage town famous for the Baidyanath Temple, one of the 12 Jyotirlingas.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Ranchi (250 km) or train to Jasidih (7 km).

destinations.name: Ranchi Waterfalls
destinations.overview: Ranchi, the capital, is surrounded by stunning waterfalls like Dassam and Hundru.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Ranchi (Birsa Munda Airport, 5 km) or train (500 km).

destinations.name: Netarhat
destinations.overview: Known as the 'Queen of Chotanagpur,' a serene hill station.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Ranchi (400 km) then drive 150 km.

destinations.name: Parasnath
destinations.overview: A Jain pilgrimage site with the Parasnath Hill and temples.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Parasnath Station (600 km) or fly to Ranchi (200 km).

destinations.name: Coorg
destinations.overview: A hill station famous for coffee plantations and misty landscapes.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Mangalore (300 km) or train to Mysore (120 km), then drive.

destinations.name: Hampi
destinations.overview: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with ancient ruins of the Vijayanagara Empire.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Hospet (12 km, 330 km) or drive (380 km).

destinations.name: Gokarna
destinations.overview: A laid-back beach town with temples and pristine shores.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Gokarna Road (10 km, 580 km) or fly to Goa (150 km).

destinations.name: Mysore
destinations.overview: A cultural city known for its palace, silk, and sandalwood.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train (650 km) or fly to Mysore Airport (10 km).

destinations.name: Jog Falls
destinations.overview: One of India’s highest waterfalls, surrounded by lush greenery.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Shimoga (80 km, 600 km) then drive.

destinations.name: Munnar
destinations.overview: A hill station with tea plantations, misty hills, and cool climate.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kochi (130 km) or train to Aluva (110 km), then drive.

destinations.name: Alleppey (Backwaters)
destinations.overview: Famous for houseboat cruises through serene backwaters.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Alleppey (600 km) or fly to Kochi (80 km).

destinations.name: Wayanad
destinations.overview: A lush district with forests, waterfalls, and wildlife.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kozhikode (100 km) or train to Kozhikode (600 km).

destinations.name: Kovalam
destinations.overview: A coastal town with crescent-shaped beaches and a lighthouse.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Trivandrum (15 km) or train (700 km).

destinations.name: Thekkady
destinations.overview: Home to Periyar National Park, known for wildlife and spice plantations.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Kochi (150 km) or train to Kottayam (110 km).

destinations.name: Khajuraho
destinations.overview: A UNESCO site famous for its intricately carved temples.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Khajuraho (5 km) or train to Satna (120 km, 900 km).

destinations.name: Kanha National Park
destinations.overview: A tiger reserve that inspired Rudyard Kipling’s Jungle Book.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Jabalpur (170 km) or train (700 km).

destinations.name: Pachmarhi
destinations.overview: A hill station with waterfalls, caves, and colonial charm.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Pipariya (50 km, 800 km) or fly to Bhopal (200 km).

destinations.name: Ujjain
destinations.overview: A spiritual city with the Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Ujjain (850 km) or fly to Indore (55 km).

destinations.name: Gwalior
destinations.overview: A historic city with a grand fort and rich musical heritage.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Gwalior (10 km) or train (950 km).

destinations.name: Mumbai
destinations.overview: India’s financial capital, blending Bollywood, beaches, and history.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Mumbai (CSMIA, 10 km, 620 km) or train (12 hours).

destinations.name: Ajanta & Ellora Caves
destinations.overview: UNESCO-listed rock-cut caves with ancient Buddhist art.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Aurangabad (230 km) or train (500 km).

destinations.name: Mahabaleshwar
destinations.overview: A hill station famous for strawberries and misty valleys.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Pune (120 km) or train to Satara (60 km, 700 km).

destinations.name: Lonavala
destinations.overview: A popular hill station with waterfalls and lush greenery.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Fly to Pune (65 km) or train to Lonavala (620 km).

destinations.name: Shirdi
destinations.overview: A pilgrimage town dedicated to Sai Baba.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Hyderabad: Train to Shirdi (550 km) or fly to Aurangabad (120 km).

destinations.name: Loktak Lake
destinations.overview: The largest freshwater lake in Northeast India, famous for its floating phumdis and scenic beauty.

hotels.name: Maipakchao Homestay
hotels.description: Cozy local stay with lake access.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Imphal: Drive 48 km (1-2 hours) via NH- ravaged150.
travel_details.tips: Hire a boat for phumdi exploration.

destinations.name: Imphal
destinations.overview: The capital city of Manipur, rich in history and culture.

hotels.name: The Classic Hotel
hotels.description: Urban luxury in the heart of Imphal.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Imphal Airport (Tulihal, 8 km from city center).

destinations.name: Kangla Fort
destinations.overview: A historic fort in Imphal, once the seat of Manipuri kings.

hotels.name: The Classic Hotel
hotels.description: Close to Kangla with luxury amenities.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Located in central Imphal, 8 km from Imphal Airport.
travel_details.tips: Visit in the morning for peace.

destinations.name: Keibul Lamjao National Park
destinations.overview: The world’s only floating national park, home to the endangered Sangai deer.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Imphal: Drive 53 km (1.5-2 hours).

destinations.name: Dzuko Valley
destinations.overview: A stunning valley on the Manipur-Nagaland border, famous for its lilies and treks.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Imphal: Drive to Mao (100 km), then trek.

destinations.name: Shillong
destinations.overview: The capital of Meghalaya, known as the Scotland of the East.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Shillong Airport (30 km) or Guwahati (100 km).

destinations.name: Cherrapunji
destinations.overview: One of the wettest places on Earth, famous for waterfalls and caves.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Shillong: Drive 50 km (1.5-2 hours).

destinations.name: Living Root Bridges
destinations.overview: Unique bio-engineered bridges made by Khasi tribes.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Shillong: Drive to Cherrapunji (50 km), then trek.

destinations.name: Dawki
destinations.overview: A border town with crystal-clear Umngot River and Indo-Bangladesh trade.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Shillong: Drive 82 km (2-3 hours).

destinations.name: Mawlynnong
destinations.overview: Asia’s cleanest village, known for its living root bridge and charm.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Shillong: Drive 90 km (2.5-3 hours).

destinations.name: Aizawl
destinations.overview: The capital of Mizoram, perched on hills with vibrant Mizo culture.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Lengpui Airport (32 km) or drive from Silchar (180 km).

destinations.name: Vantawng Falls
destinations.overview: Mizoram’s highest waterfall, surrounded by lush greenery.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Aizawl: Drive 50 km (1.5-2 hours).

destinations.name: Reiek
destinations.overview: A hill station with panoramic views and Mizo heritage village.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Aizawl: Drive 30 km (1-1.5 hours).

destinations.name: Champhai
destinations.overview: A border town near Myanmar, known as the rice bowl of Mizoram.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Aizawl: Drive 190 km (6-7 hours).

destinations.name: Tamdil Lake
destinations.overview: A serene artificial lake surrounded by forests, ideal for boating.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Aizawl: Drive 78 km (2-3 hours).

destinations.name: Kohima
destinations.overview: The capital of Nagaland, known for its WWII history and tribal culture.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Dimapur (74 km) or train to Dimapur, then drive.

destinations.name: Dzukou Valley
destinations.overview: A picturesque valley shared with Manipur, famous for its lilies.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Kohima: Drive to Viswema (25 km), then trek.

destinations.name: Mokokchung
destinations.overview: A cultural hub of the Ao Naga tribe with scenic hills.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Kohima: Drive 150 km (4-5 hours).

destinations.name: Mon
destinations.overview: Home of the Konyak Naga tribe, known for tattooed headhunters.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Kohima: Drive 300 km (8-9 hours).

destinations.name: Japfu Peak
destinations.overview: The second-highest peak in Nagaland, offering stunning views.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Kohima: Drive to Kigwema (15 km), then trek.

destinations.name: Puri
destinations.overview: A coastal pilgrimage city famous for Jagannath Temple and beaches.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Train to Puri or fly to Bhubaneswar (60 km).

destinations.name: Konark Sun Temple
destinations.overview: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, an architectural marvel shaped like a chariot.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Puri: Drive 35 km (1 hour).
travel_details.tips: Visit at sunrise for best light.

destinations.name: Chilika Lake
destinations.overview: Asia’s largest brackish water lagoon, a haven for migratory birds.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Bhubaneswar: Drive 100 km (2-3 hours).

destinations.name: Bhubaneswar
destinations.overview: The temple city of Odisha, blending ancient heritage with modernity.

travel_details.how_to_reach: Fly to Biju Patnaik Airport (5 km from city).

destinations.name: Simlipal National Park
destinations.overview: A tiger reserve with dense forests and waterfalls in northern Odisha.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Bhubaneswar: Drive 200 km (4-5 hours).

destinations.name: Golden Temple (Amritsar)
destinations.overview: A sacred Sikh shrine with stunning architecture.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Delhi: Fly to Amritsar Airport (11 km) or train (450 km).

destinations.name: Wagah Border
destinations.overview: The India-Pakistan border with a ceremonial retreat.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Amritsar: Drive 30 km (45 mins).

destinations.name: Jallianwala Bagh
destinations.overview: A historic site of the 1919 massacre.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Amritsar: 1 km (5 mins walk from Golden Temple).

destinations.name: Anandpur Sahib
destinations.overview: A Sikh holy city, birthplace of Khalsa.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Chandigarh: Drive 80 km (2 hours).

destinations.name: Patiala
destinations.overview: A royal city with forts and Punjabi heritage.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Chandigarh: Drive 60 km (1.5 hours).

destinations.name: Jaipur
destinations.overview: The Pink City, known for forts and palaces.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Delhi: Fly to Jaipur Airport (12 km) or train (260 km).

destinations.name: Udaipur
destinations.overview: The City of Lakes with royal palaces.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Jaipur: Drive 400 km (6 hours) or fly to Udaipur Airport (22 km).

destinations.name: Jaisalmer
destinations.overview: The Golden City with desert forts and dunes.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Jaipur: Drive 560 km (9 hours) or train to Jaisalmer (600 km).

destinations.name: Mount Abu
destinations.overview: Rajasthan’s only hill station with lakes and temples.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Udaipur: Drive 160 km (3 hours).

destinations.name: Ranthambore National Park
destinations.overview: A tiger reserve with a historic fort.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Jaipur: Drive 180 km (3.5 hours).

destinations.name: Gangtok
destinations.overview: The capital with monasteries and Himalayan views.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Bagdogra: Drive 125 km (4 hours).
travel_details.best_time: March to June, October to December

destinations.name: Nathula Pass
destinations.overview: A high-altitude pass on the Indo-China border.

travel_details.how_to_reach: From Gangtok: Drive 56 km (2 hours).
travel_details.best_time: April to June, October to November
